conclusion: Analyze forces on object A and deformation of springs B and C.
Object A has mass m = 2 kg.
Spring B has spring constant k1 = 200 N/m.
Spring C is not deformed when its right endpoint is at position a.
Distance between positions a and b is ab = 60 cm = 0.6 m.
Tension force of spring B on object A equals gravitational force of A, TB = mg = 19.6 N.
Using Hooke's Law, TB = k1 x, solve for x: x = 0.098 m = 9.8 cm.
Height rise of object A is equal to extension of spring B, which is 9.8 cm.
Using Pythagorean theorem, calculate y: y = 178.5 cm.
Force exerted by spring C is equal to tension in spring B, solve for k2: k2 = 11.0 N/m.
Final answers: Height rise of A is 9.8 cm, stiffness coefficient k2 is 11.0 N/m.
